intro: Roettlera tibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan roettlera, is a perennial herb native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
